document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic review of Chinese species of ground beetles of the subgenus Pseudoophonus (genus Harpalus) (Coleoptera: Carabidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic review of Chinese species of ground beetles of the subgenus Pseudoophonus (genus Harpalus) (Coleoptera: Carabidae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Harpalus pastor
Motschulsky, 1844
: 208
. Type locality: "frontiere de la Mongolie ".

Harpalus ( Pardileus ) tschiliensis Schauberger, 1829 : 186
. Type locality: "Tschi-Li [= Hebei]; Hupe Johong", China .
Harpalus ( Pardileus ) tschiliensis sutschanensis
Schauberger, 1929
: 187
. Type locality: "Sutschan, Ussuri", Russia .
Harpalus ( Pardileus ) tschiliensis hweisinensis Schauberger, 1829 : 188
. Type locality: "Hweisin", Gansu, China .
Harpalus ( Pardileus ) tschiliensis szetschuanensis
Schauberger, 1930
: 177
. Type locality: "Kwanshien und Mts. Yunling" (Sichuan), "Mts. Wuschan" (Hupeh), "Mts. Toyentschan" (Guangxi), and "Fokien" (Fujian), China .
Harpalus ( Pardileus ) tschiliensis szetschuanensis
ab. lateripunctatus
Schauberger, 1930
: 177
(unavailable name). Type locality: "Kwanshien und Yunling", Sichuan, China .

Harpalus ( Pseudoophonus ) penglainus
Huang, Hu & Sun, 1994
: 264
, 268, syn. n. Type locality: Penglai, Shandong, China .
Harpalus ( Pseudoophonus ) chiloschizontus Huang
in
Huang & Zhang, 1995
: 114
, 117, syn. n. Type locality: Wuyi Mt, Fujian, China .

, Liao Subai collector" [in Chinese ], "

sp. n. , 1993.6 . 28 , det. Huang Tongling" ( IOZ ).

Distribution . China : the north-eastern, eastern and south-eastern parts. It was recorded from Heilongjiang, Liaoning, Nei Mongol, Shaanxi, Hebei, Shandong, Shanxi, Henan, Jiangsu, Shanghai, Zhejiang, Gansu, Sichuan, Hubei, Hunan, Guizhou, Fujian, Guangxi, and Guangdong (
Kataev et al . 2003
;
Liang & Liu 2007
). As
H. niigatanus ,
Hua ( 2002 )
reported probably this species also from Jilin and Anhui.
Harpalus pastor
is recorded here from Beijing and Xizang for the first time. Additional material from Shaanxi, Henan and Hunan is also provided.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 32–35.
Harpalus
, median lobe of aedeagus. 32–33,
H. pastor
(Zhejiang); 34–35,
H. fokienensis
(Fujian). 32, 34, view from the left side; 33, 35, dorsal view. Scale = 1.0 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks . The geographical variation of
H. pastor
and status of the taxa described by Schauberger (1929 , 1930 ) were discussed by Kataev (1997 , 2002 ). The species is variable geographically, but only
H. p. niigatanus
Schauberger occurring in Japan , discriminated by glabrous lateral intervals of the elytra and shorter metepisterna, warrants the rank of a subspecies.

Examination of the type specimens of
H. penglainus
and
H. chiloschizontus
, described from Shandong and Fujian provinces respectively, revealed that both these taxa are conspecific with the nominative subspecies of
H. pastor
.
